intro: Solanum zanzibarense var. vagans, commonly known as the Zanzibar nightshade, is a herbaceous plant native to the coastal regions of East Africa. It belongs to the nightshade family (Solanaceae) and is characterized by its hairy stems and opposite leaves. The plant produces small, star-shaped flowers that are typically white or pale purple, followed by berries that change color from green to red as they mature. It thrives in humid, tropical climates and is often found growing in coastal vegetation and disturbed sites. Due to its ornamental value and potential medicinal properties, it is sometimes cultivated in gardens and traditional herbal practices.
